item.title: My thinking in 3rd term has changed vastly in terms of vision, scope: PM Modi on podcast with Nikhil Kama - The Times of India
item.description:
PM Modi Discusses Changed Vision in 3rd Term on Podcast with Nikhil Kamath

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

The Prime Minister of India, Narendra Modi, shared insights into how his vision and approach have significantly evolved during his third term in office during a podcast conversation with entrepreneur Nikhil Kamath.

  • Modi emphasized the importance of adapting and broadening perspectives in governance.
  • He discussed various initiatives that reflect this evolved vision.
  • The podcast highlighted moments of personal reflection and key decision-making processes.
“Leadership is about evolving, understanding, and meeting the challenges of the time.” - PM Narendra Modi

This dialogue illustrates how political leaders are increasingly aware of the need for adaptability in response to contemporary challenges.

item.title: Delhi court to CBI in Karti Chidambaram corruption case: 'Give 3-day pre-arrest notice' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Court Orders CBI to Give Pre-Arrest Notice in Karti Chidambaram Case

Date: Jan 10, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi court has instructed the CBI to provide a three-day written notice before arresting Congress MP Karti Chidambaram as part of a fresh corruption investigation.

  • A court ordered the CBI to notify Chidambaram about his arrest three days in advance.
  • Chidambaram is accused of aiding Diageo Scotland regarding the ban on duty-free liquor sales.
  • The CBI's investigation is centered around suspicious payments to Advantage Strategic Consulting, linked to Chidambaram.
"The investigating agency shall give three days written notice before the applicant in case his arrest is required..." - Judge Kaveri Baweja

This case adds to Chidambaram's ongoing legal challenges, including accusations related to the INX Media case.

item.title: Makar Sankranti 2025: What it means for your zodiac sign - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Makar Sankranti 2025: What it means for your zodiac sign

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The auspicious festival of Makar Sankranti will be celebrated on January 14, 2025, marking the Sun's shift into Capricorn, symbolizing the end of winters and the arrival of brighter days. It is a time of hope, growth, and fresh goals.

  • The Sun’s presence in Capricorn encourages discipline and hard work.
  • This period is ideal for self-reflection and planning for the year ahead.
  • Each zodiac sign experiences unique influences and opportunities during this transit.
“It is a time of introspection and goal-setting for the year.”

Makar Sankranti invites individuals to align their ambitions with practical actions, creating a fertile ground for personal growth and zodiac-specific insights.

item.title: Yogi Adityanath's ‘denting-painting’ warning to Waqf ahead of Maha Kumbh 2025 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Yogi Adityanath's Warning to Waqf Ahead of Maha Kumbh 2025

Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Maha Kumbh is being celebrated after 12 years, with a huge turnout of devotees expected in Prayagraj from January 13 to February 26.

  • Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath issued a warning to the Waqf Board regarding land claims ahead of the Maha Kumbh.
  • He stated that anyone wishing to claim land would face consequences, referring to 'denting-painting'.
  • Adityanath welcomed those respecting Indian traditions but criticized claims from the Waqf Board regarding land issues.
  • The statement comes after an AIMJ president's claim about land rights and entry for Muslims during the Kumbh Mela preparations.
  • No discrimination during the Maha Kumbh was promised by Adityanath, but he affirmed the reclaiming of Waqf land.
  • The event is anticipated to attract over 45 crore devotees.
“The Kumbh has been a symbol of India's heritage for thousands of years and has always taken place here.”

The Maha Kumbh 2025 is expected to be a significant event, marking a major spiritual gathering with a large influx of devotees in Prayagraj.

item.title: Who would be Narendra Modi's first call after his happiest moment? PM answers - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who would be Narendra Modi's first call after his happiest moment? PM answers

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In his first podcast appearance, Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared that his mother would have been the first person he would call during his happiest moment. He reflected on significant events in his life and emphasized the importance of family.

  • PM Modi discussed personal moments, including a pivotal call to his mother after hoisting the Indian flag at Lal Chowk in Srinagar.
  • He recalled his experience during an attack on his convoy in Punjab and the emotional significance of the call.
  • Modi talked about his childhood, political challenges, and lessons learned along the way.
  • The Prime Minister acknowledged his humanity and the inevitability of making mistakes.
“For me, it was a moment of joy and I also thought that my mother would have been worried.” - PM Narendra Modi

This podcast marks an intimate look at Modi's thoughts on family, politics, and his life experiences.

item.title: Needless inconvenience: PDP criticises reports of mandatory deboarding of train passengers at Katra - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
PDP Criticises Mandatory Deboarding of Train Passengers at Katra

Date: January 10 | Source: Srinagar

The People's Democratic Party (PDP) has criticized the reports requiring train passengers traveling to and from Kashmir to deboard at Katra due to security issues, calling it a needless inconvenience.

  • The PDP labels the requirement as an unnecessary burden on Kashmiris.
  • Party officials argue that this contradicts the purported benefits of train services to the region.
  • PDP leader Mohammad Khurshid Alam expressed that this directive undermines the promised convenience in travel for Kashmiris.
  • The measure particularly affects vulnerable groups like the elderly and those seeking medical treatment.
“For years, we were told that train services to Kashmir would benefit the common masses and ease travel. This latest directive shows that Kashmiris are still far from experiencing any real travel convenience.” - Mohammad Khurshid Alam

This move has sparked concerns about the effectiveness and intentions behind the security measures being implemented.

item.title: JEE Main 2025 City Intimation Slip released at jeemain.nta.nic.in; Direct link here - Moneycontrol
item.description:
JEE Main 2025 City Intimation Slip Released

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the JEE Main 2025 City Allotment Slip for Session 1. Candidates can now check their allotted exam city on the official website jeemain.nta.nic.in.

  • JEE Main 2025 City Allotment Slip has been made available.
  • Candidates can download the slip from the official NTA website.
  • This slip includes important information about exam center locations.
“JEE Main 2025 City Allotment Slip OUT!”

For students appearing for JEE Main Session 1, this is crucial information regarding their exam schedule.

item.title: Sambhal mosque well row: SC orders status quo, issues notice to Centre, ASI - The Hindu
item.description:
Supreme Court Maintains Status Quo at Sambhal Mosque

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court has directed that the status quo be maintained regarding a well near the Shahi Jama Masjid at Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh, following an application from the mosque management committee.

  • The court issued directives to local authorities and private respondents to file counter-affidavits within two weeks.
  • Concerns were raised regarding plans to refer the site as ‘Hari Mandir’ and the commencement of religious activities.
  • Legal representatives presented historical significance of the well and its longstanding usage by the mosque.
  • The case is scheduled to be posted for hearing on February 25, 2025.
  • Last year, the Supreme Court intervened to maintain peace following violent clashes in the area.
“No such activities will be permitted. Please file a status report,” - Chief Justice Khanna

This ruling aims to preserve the historical and cultural heritage associated with the mosque and its surroundings, continuing to monitor any future developments related to the site.

item.title: Srinagar-Delhi train service should operate directly without causing inconvenience to passengers: Altaf Bukhari - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
Srinagar-Delhi Train Service Should Be Direct, Says Altaf Bukhari

Date: January 10 | Source: Jammu & Kashmir Apni Party

Jammu & Kashmir Apni Party (JKAP) president Syed Mohammad Altaf Bukhari has expressed concerns over the proposed Srinagar-Delhi train service, urging that the service operate directly without requiring passengers to switch trains at the Katra Railway Station.

  • Bukhari highlighted that reports indicated passengers would need to change trains at the Mata Vaishno Devi Railway Station in Katra.
  • Passengers would have to disembark, leave the station, re-enter, and rescan luggage, which he described as troubling and humiliating.
  • He called for railway authorities to find alternative safety measures rather than inconveniencing travelers.
  • Bukhari criticized the current arrangements as turning a potentially seamless journey into a hectic one.
“This arrangement would be troubling and humiliating for the passengers.”
“Amid much hype, people believed that the first-ever Srinagar-Delhi train service would be fast, seamless, and comfortable.”

In conclusion, Bukhari urges the railway authorities to prioritize passenger comfort and streamline the service to maintain its intended benefits.

item.title: Congress takes dig at PM Modi over ‘I'm not a God' remark in podcast with Nikhil Kamath - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Congress Criticizes PM Modi for His 'I'm Not a God' Comment in Recent Podcast

Date: Jan 10, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent podcast with Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath, Prime Minister Narendra Modi stated, 'I am human who can make mistakes, not some God,' prompting a reaction from the Congress party.

  • The podcast aired on YouTube, where PM Modi discussed his past as Gujarat's chief minister.
  • Congress MP Jairam Ramesh criticized Modi's comment as a form of damage control.
  • Ramesh referred to Modi's previous assertion that he was 'sent by God' before the 2024 Lok Sabha elections.

Key Remarks from PM Modi

During the podcast, he emphasized, 'Everyone makes mistakes, including me,' contrasting earlier statements where he claimed divine inspiration for his actions.

“Until my mother was alive, I used to think I was born biologically... I am convinced that I was sent by God.”

The Congress party's response highlights ongoing political tensions as the elections approach.

item.title: ACB files case against 2 Srinagar Smart City Limited officials - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
ACB Files Case Against Two Officials of Srinagar Smart City Limited

Date: Jan 10, Source: Greater Kashmir

The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has registered cases against two employees of Srinagar Smart City Limited for allegedly possessing disproportionate assets.

  • ACB officials announced the registration at a press conference.
  • Individuals involved are Sajid Yousuf Bhat, Chief Financial Officer, and Zahoor Ahmad Dar, Executive Engineer.
  • The bureau is currently conducting searches at seven locations related to the investigation.
  • Details regarding the investigation are limited pending searches.
The ACB stated, “The duo has managed to get assets much higher than their lawful income.”

The investigation is ongoing, and further details will be provided after its completion.

item.title: Twist in ‘rape-suicide’ case of 2 girls in Palakkad as CBI arraigns parents as accused - The Indian Express
item.description:
Twist in 'Rape-Suicide' Case of Two Girls in Palakkad as CBI Files Charges Against Parents

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

A 2017 case involving the alleged suicide of two minor girls in Palakkad has seen a significant development with the CBI charging the parents as accused for abetting the abuse and subsequent suicides.

  • The two girls, aged 9 and 13, were found hanging at their home in 2017.
  • The parents are charged under IPC section 109 and the POCSO Act for failing to report the abuse.
  • The CBI's supplementary chargesheet states that the parents were aware of the abuse but did not inform authorities.
  • A special POCSO court had previously acquitted four of the accused in 2019 due to lack of evidence.
  • Political fallout ensued as the victims' mother alleged police misconduct and later contested in elections.
“This case continues to stir political and social dialogues about justice and accountability.”

The developments in this case highlight the complexities surrounding allegations of abuse and the law's response to these tragic events.

item.title: Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones - The Indian Express
item.description:
Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

This year's Maha Kumbh in Prayagraj features significant technological advancements with extensive use of CCTV and AI.

  • Over 2,750 CCTV cameras will monitor the festival grounds.
  • The initiative aims to manage the anticipated influx of 40 crore pilgrims.
  • Vijaypuri Bapu, a sadhu, faces challenges with internet connectivity affecting his use of Kumbh apps.
  • The Digi Kumbh initiative marks a substantial investment in digital infrastructure by the Uttar Pradesh government.
“I have been playing bhajans (hymns) and taking photos on my phone. Since there is no Internet, I cannot use any of the Kumbh apps,” says Vijaypuri Bapu.

The digital advancements aim to enhance safety and service at the Maha Kumbh mela, making it a technologically advanced gathering.

item.title: After two postponements in maiden space docking mission, Isro says it will now ‘dock and inform’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
After two postponements in maiden space docking mission, Isro says it will now ‘dock and inform’

Publication Date: January 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro) has decided to proceed with its SpaDeX space docking mission without public announcement after two previous postponements. The agency will conduct the docking and subsequently inform the public.

  • The docking was initially scheduled for January 7 and then postponed to January 9.
  • A new chairman for Isro, V Narayanan, will assume leadership on January 14.
  • The SpaDeX mission is a technology demonstrator for future space operations such as the Chandrayaan missions and building a space station.
  • The spacecraft, SDX01 and SDX02, launched on December 30, will gradually approach each other for docking.
“The docking experiment is called for on account of many reasons. The immediate one is Chandrayaan 4 but later for the space station planned for India,” stated a former Isro official.

In conclusion, Isro's revised approach reflects the agency's commitment to ensuring successful autonomy in space operations, emphasizing reliable and efficient communication with the public moving forward.

item.title: "I'm Only Human, Not God": PM Modi In Podcast Debut With Zerodha Chief Nikhil Kamath - NDTV
item.description:
I'm Only Human, Not God: PM Modi In Podcast Debut With Zerodha Chief Nikhil Kamath

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: News Article

In his debut podcast appearance on Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath's show, Prime Minister Narendra Modi acknowledged his flaws, stating, 'I too can make mistakes.' He comforted Kamath over his Hindi skills, emphasizing their shared understanding.

  • Prime Minister Modi discusses his humanity and the inevitability of mistakes.
  • Nikhil Kamath expresses concerns about his language skills due to his South Indian background.
  • The podcast covers Modi’s childhood, education, and challenges faced in politics.
  • PM Modi actively engages with Kamath, making the dialogue personal and relatable.
  • Modi shared a light-hearted anecdote about his childhood chores.
'Mistakes happen, and I too can make some. I am also a human, not god.' - PM Modi

Modi shared a heartfelt message with listeners, hoping they enjoyed the podcast as much as he did creating it.

item.title: Creamy Layer Exclusion From SC/ST Reservation To Be Decided By Executive/Legislature : Supreme Court... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court to Decide on Exclusion of 'Creamy Layer' from SC/ST Reservation

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

The Supreme Court has declined to hear a petition seeking the exclusion of the children of IAS/IPS/IFS/IRS/Class-I officers from SC/ST reservation, stating that the issue falls under the domain of the executive and legislature.

  • The court upheld the petitioner’s right to withdraw the petition while allowing further legal action.
  • It was argued that a definition of 'creamy layer' should be established for the SC/ST reservation policy.
  • Counsel referred to a prior Supreme Court judgment advocating for a classification within SC/ST beneficiaries.
  • Justice Gavai emphasized that reservation is an enabling provision and not mandatory.
  • The current status of the state of MP was criticized for a lack of action following the Supreme Court's earlier judgment.
“Reservation is not mandatory. It is for the executive and for the legislature to provide reservation or not.” - Justice BR Gavai

The Supreme Court refrains from interfering at this stage, leaving the decision to the legislative process regarding the exclusion policy.

item.title: PM Narendra Modi makes podcast debut with Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath: Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Narendra Modi makes podcast debut with Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath: 'I am not a God'

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In his first podcast, PM Narendra Modi discusses integrity in politics and reflects on his past mistakes.

  • PM Narendra Modi acknowledged his podcast debut, responding, “This is my first podcast, I don't know how it'll go with your audience.”
  • Modi reflected on a previous speech from his tenure as Gujarat's chief minister, stating, “I said something in an insensitive way. Mistakes happen. I am human, not a God.”
  • “My first wish when I became CM was to invite all my school friends to CM House,” said PM Modi.
  • “I used to wash the clothes of all my family members. Because of that, I was allowed to go to the pond,” Modi on his childhood.
  • “One should enter politics with a mission, not with ambition,” Modi said.
“Mistakes happen. I am human, not a God.” - PM Narendra Modi

This podcast marks a significant moment for PM Modi as he shares insights and encourages integrity and mission-driven participation in politics.

item.title: Class 3 female student of Zebar School in Thaltej dies of suspected cardiac arrest - DeshGujarat
item.description:
Class 3 female student of Zebar School in Thaltej dies of suspected cardiac arrest

Date: Today
Source: DeshGujarat

In a tragic incident, a class 3 student at Zebar School for Children, Thaltej, has died after complaining of chest pain.

  • The student, Gargi Ranpara, was around 8-9 years old.
  • She arrived at school at 7:30 AM and collapsed on the stairs after complaining of chest pain.
  • The school staff performed CPR but could not revive her.
  • She was rushed to a nearby hospital, where she was declared dead.
  • Preliminary reports indicate cardiac arrest as the cause of death.
  • The school administration confirmed that Gargi had no prior history of cardiac issues.
  • The police are reviewing CCTV footage as part of their investigation.
“The cardiac arrest was sad and sudden,” stated the school’s administration.

This heartbreaking event has raised concerns about the health monitoring of students in schools.
